io.micronaut.configuration.kafka.processor

Class KafkaConsumerProcessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.micronaut.configuration.kafka.processor.KafkaConsumerProcessor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ConsumerRegistry, io.micronaut.context.processor.AnnotationProcessor<Topic,io.micronaut.inject.ExecutableMethod<?,?>>, io.micronaut.context.processor.ExecutableMethodProcessor<Topic>, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    @Singleton
 @Requires(beans=KafkaDefaultConfiguration.class)
public class KafkaConsumerProcessor
extends java.lang.Object
implements io.micronaut.context.processor.ExecutableMethodProcessor<Topic>, java.lang.AutoCloseable, ConsumerRegistry

    A ExecutableMethodProcessor that will process all beans annotated with KafkaListener and create and subscribe the relevant methods as consumers to Kafka topics.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Graeme Rocher

      Creates a new processor using the given ExecutorService to schedule consumers on.

      • pause

        public void pause(@NonNull
                  java.lang.String id)
        Description copied from interface: ConsumerRegistry
        Pause the consumer for the given ID. Note that this method will request that the consumer is paused, however does not block until the consumer is actually paused. You can use the ConsumerRegistry.isPaused(String) method to establish when the consumer has actually been paused.
        Specified by:
        pause in interface ConsumerRegistry
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the consumer

      • pause

        public void pause(@NonNull
                  java.lang.String id,
                  @NonNull
                  java.util.Collection<TopicPartition> topicPartitions)
        Description copied from interface: ConsumerRegistry
        Pause the consumer for the given ID to consume from the given topic partitions. Note that this method will request that the consumer is paused, however does not block until the consumer is actually paused. You can use the ConsumerRegistry.isPaused(String, Collection) method to establish when the consumer has actually been paused for the topic partitions.
        Specified by:
        pause in interface ConsumerRegistry
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the consumer
        topicPartitions - The topic partitions to pause consuming from

      • resume

        public void resume(@NonNull
                   java.lang.String id)
        Description copied from interface: ConsumerRegistry
        Resume the consumer for the given ID. Note that this method will request that the consumer is resumed, however does not block until the consumer is actually resumed. You can use the ConsumerRegistry.isPaused(String) method to establish when the consumer has actually been resumed.
        Specified by:
        resume in interface ConsumerRegistry
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the consumer

      • resume

        public void resume(@NonNull
                   java.lang.String id,
                   @NonNull
                   java.util.Collection<TopicPartition> topicPartitions)
        Description copied from interface: ConsumerRegistry
        Resume the consumer for the given ID to consume from the given topic partitions. Note that this method will request that the consumer is resumed, however does not block until the consumer is actually resumed. You can use the ConsumerRegistry.isPaused(String, Collection) method to establish when the consumer has actually been resumed to consume from the given topic partitions.
        Specified by:
        resume in interface ConsumerRegistry
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the consumer
        topicPartitions - The topic partitions to pause consuming from
